content:
Try deleting the app folder, then go to https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ > choose your version > reinstall.

To find the app folder location, see TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Info > Application Basics > Application Binary.
creator: siffemoz

content: I am sorry, but to do that I would need to know what mail provider you used so I could look it up in the database Thunderbird uses or on your providers website. Perhaps you could do that and cut out the middle man.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Unfortunately, there is no easy solution. Thunderbird's junk filter can help, but it requires active and frequent training. More info at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages I also suggest checking to see if your email provider offers a junk filter online, such as Spamassasin. I, personally, use Mailwasher and have found it addresses the issue quite well (it's free for one account and this is NOT an official endorsement.)
